commitMessage:
OS-6409 import Pluribus bhyve port

comments.message:
Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1

I took a quick pass through, checking copyrights, makefiles, and general sanity. This looks fine to me since it is just a baseline which we expect to change a lot in the upcoming revs.

Patch Set 1:

Did we reconcile with upstream about the "contrib" directory being in usr/contrib ?

Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1

> Did we reconcile with upstream about the "contrib" directory being
 > in usr/contrib ?

we've not reconciled
I know there's some we might share with the loader project
but I really don't want to end up sharing headers
like if we're updating those files at a different cadence
I don't know what the plans are
I think for us, we just want to get the thing landed
and if it needs to be massaged later, we can do that

Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1

Presuming the intent is to land this code but not to build it, I'm happy.  Subsequent wads will change that.

Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1

I ran this wad through a full smartos-live build cycle (DEBUG enabled), which it completed successfully.
Uploaded patch set 2: Patch Set 1 was rebased.
Uploaded patch set 3: Commit message was updated.
Change has been successfully merged by Patrick Mooney
